titles.title: He Looked for A City (word to music tough matc

properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1

verse.name: c1
v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}He looked for a city and lived in a tent A pilgrim to glory right onward he went God's promise his solace so royal his birth No wonder he sought not the glories of earth{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}He looked for a city his God should prepare No mansion on earth could he covet or share For had not God told him that royal abode Awaited His pilgrims who kept to the road{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}He looked for a city if sometimes he sighed To be trudging the road all earth's glory denied The thought of that city changed sighing to song For the road might be rough but it could not be long{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}He looked for a city his hope Lord we share And know that bright city which Thou dost prepare We'll dwell in forever since willing to be Just pilgrims with Jesus our roof a tent tree{/lang-eng}
